description: Google began developing the WebP 2 format in June 2021 to replace the WebP format, which Google released in 2010. Google initially released WebP as an open format to improve upon the JPEG , PNG , and GIF formats. Images you will most likely see saved in the WebP 2 format are digital photos and web graphics.
Images saved in the WebP format are saved with the .webp file extension ( .WEBP files), whereas images saved in the WebP 2 format are saved with the .wp2 file extension (WP2 files).
